edu.umd.cs.dmonner.tweater.finder
Class Finder

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      edu.umd.cs.dmonner.tweater.finder.Finder
All Implemented Interfaces:
FinderControl, java.lang.Runnable, java.rmi.Remote
public class Finder
extends java.lang.Thread
implements FinderControl

Controls and directs a search, possibly across many worker machines, for full information about a list of statuses whose IDs are known (generally as the result of the filler script or some other tool that identifies relevant status IDs). Manages the global search queue, farms out status searchers to FinderWorker processes, and, upon receiving complete statuses from these workers, persists them using the associated StatusEater instance.

Author:
dmonner

ignore

public void ignore(long status_id)
Description copied from interface: FinderControl
Instructs the server to not expect a call to process from the worker tasked with finding the status with the given ID, because the status was unavailable, invalid, or an error occurred with the worker.

Specified by:
ignore in interface FinderControl
Parameters:
status_id - The ID of the status the server should ignore.

Description copied from interface: FinderControl
Called by a worker upon finding a status that the server wants. Instructs the server to process and persist the status using its StatusEater instance.

shutdown

public void shutdown()
Description copied from interface: FinderControl
Instructs the server to cease sending IDs to workers to be processed. Similarly, instructs workers to stop finding statuses and shut down.
